challengeName: Hercules OnCampus HTML Android TV App - Playback implementation
detailedRequirements:
Overview

The Hercules University application is a set of apps for iOS, Android, and the web, allowing users to watch live TV and On Demand videos on Universities.

This F2F challenge will add playback to an existing HTML Android TV App by capturing specific HTML requests and passing them through to playback screens we have implemented in a separate Android TV App.

Code

Please request access to the code in the F2F challenge forum for this challenge.  If you get a 404 when accessing one of the links below, it means you don't have access.

The existing code for our current Android TV app is here:

https://gitlab.com/team-autobots/androidtv/

The existing code for our current HTML Android TV app is here:  THIS IS THE CODE YOU WILL BE UPDATING:

https://gitlab.com/team-autobots/firetv-wrapper/


Building Code

There is a README.md file here that explains test accounts and how to build the Android TV app.  The steps are basically the same for the HTML version of the app.  I just use "gradlew clean" and "gradlew installDebug" to install on an actual device.

https://gitlab.com/team-autobots/androidtv/blob/master/README.md


Requirements

We currently have login and browsing working alright in this updated HTML-based Android TV App.  The goal with this F2F is to get playback working properly when the user selects a "Watch" link.  Some basic navigation screenshots will be provided in the forum to show how you get to a "Watch" link in "On Demand".

The goal is to capture the URL that the app is trying to load, parse out the playback URL, resolve it, and pass it to the existing player screen from the native Android TV app linked above.  We will:

1. Parse out the playback URL

2. Resolve it via the 302 mechanism in the current native Android TV App 

3. Pass the resolved URL to the player, along with the XSCT token received during provision

4. Move to the playback screen (copied in from the native Android TV App), and allow for playback.

All functionality of the playback screen will work for play, pause, rewind, fast forward, skip back, and skip ahead, but we won't show any of the metadata for the video playing, since that isn't being passed from the HTML to the native playback screen at this time.  After the client reviews this proof of concept, then we may move forward to start adding some of that, but for now it isn't necessary.  

When the user clicks "back" on the remote during playback, they should be taken back to the previous screen from the HTML navigation, before they initiated playback.  At the end of the video, the user will be brought back automatically.
